meanings.definition: Past tense of coal: to supply or cover with coal
meanings.sent1: The workers coaled the furnace to keep it burning.
meanings.sent2: The train was coaled up before starting its long journey.
meanings.sent3: The dragon coaled its lair with shiny black rocks.
meanings.sent4: The night sky coaled over as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: She coaled the barbecue with charcoal, ready for grilling.

meanings.definition: Past participle of coal: supplied or covered with coal
meanings.sent1: The coaled ship sailed smoothly across the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The coaled mine was a vital source of energy for the town.
meanings.sent3: The coaled garden path glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His hands were coaled black after working in the coal mine.
meanings.sent5: The coaled locomotive billowed dark smoke into the sky.
